answers.answer: It's been 8 years since I had my son but I am sure that means that it's "old blood" maybe it's a sign that your that the bleeding will stop soon. I am not in the medical profession but I know that when I was spotting the 3rd time I was pregnant I was told that brown blood is old blood.

im not an expert but I dont think it is your period yet it is just from were you had your baby you will probally get you period in the next couple of weeks for it been brownish that means old blood so it should be going away.congrats to you and your new baby boy you must be so happy:)
my levels were 48,500.. get my u/s tommorow to see how far along i am.. cant wait.. ill keep you guys posted~*Chloe*~

Melissa, I really don't think that it is your period. I bled for 2 weeks when I had my son. My period did not come until he was about 6 weeks old. It is just you still bleeding from having him. Even though you had a C-section, you can still bleed from having him.I go to the doctor today, can't wait. My husband says that I am going to have the baby today. I don't think so, but what ever makes him happen he can just believe it.

Girl, You get the patient award of the year. It seems to me you have been waiting forever for that kid to get out of there so if it seems that long to me it must to you!! Good Luck and I sure hope today is the day!!!!

Hey, I've been out of town and just logged on and from the looks of things.....I'm guessing your finally pregnant!  Email me...I want the whole story....I'm so happy for you.  I knew it would happen eventually.....now it's time to focus on getting me pregnant!  I'm so busy this month, that believe it or not, I haven't hardly thought of ttc.  In fact, I'm not even keeping up with what day of my cycle each day is, we're just having sex often and that's it! If it happens, great, if not, then it'll happen eventually.  I feel tons better this month, simply because I'm not obsessing over it.  e mail me....can't wait to hear from you.

I just needed to say how relieved I am. I saw my specialist (finally) today and I cried so hard when I heard the heart beat again. After hemmoraging 2 weeks ago - I had almost convinced my self that expecting the worst was the best way to go. Everything is going fine and next week I go for some early screening (ultrasound and bloodwork). I feel like I just won the lottery!Shelley

Way to go, Shelley!  I am so glad for you! I was getting gray hair from all the worry!And Silo--glad to hear from you--I thought you were just taking some time off from the site...glad you are back and good luck this month.
I'm so glad for you good luck through the rest of your pregnancy.

Hey everyone. NO BABIES, OMG I give up, I don't think they are coming, lol.Chloe, that sounds like good news. Those levels sound good and high. Oh, I can't wait to find out what you see, OMG, what if it's twins. That would be cool!!As for me, AF is still really lite. Less then yesterday, weird. I'm starting to wonder why this is happening. I've never in my entire life had a lite AF. Not that they are extremely bad but never lite enough for the first couple of days for a pantyliner. It's dark now too, what's going on. I'm starting to wonder if it's an early m/c maybe. Chloe, how did your last AF go, I can't remember. I do know it was spotty for a few days but how was it at first and how many days, Maybe I'm pregnat. I'm flipping tired I know that.

Hi all..My insurance just raised their fee for hospital stays, and I was wondering...What's the typical stay.. I realize there is a range for an uncomplicated, vaginal birth, to a c-section, to an NICU baby...But an estimate would be nice..One more thing to save up for.Thanks,-Heather

Heather:Typical stay for vaginal birth is 48 hours and C-section is 96 hours.Shelly:Horray!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I am so happy to hear that everything is okay.  I was beginning to worry because we haven't heard much about you lately.  I was just about to get on and send you a post to find out.  I knew everything was going to be okay I was praying for you and your little one.  :)  I am so happy!!!!!!!!!
Heather,One or two nights with vaginal 3 to 4 nights with a c section my child was in nicu so I stayed 4nights and I had a c section. if that helps at all.

Heather,I was only in the hospital after haveing my son for only 3 days.  That is all my insurance would pay for and my son was also in the NICU.  I think the length of stay depends on how the delivery goes (which I sure will go fine)and the insurance company.  If I were you I would call your insurance company or if you have a booklet that you should have recieved when you got the insurance it should help you find what you are looking for.Mary

I took the 1 hour glucose test last week.  The doctor's office called and wants me to take the 3 hour glucose test.  Did this happen to anyone else?  Diabetes is very common on both sides of my family.  Does that make me more likely to have gestational diabetes?

Hey i'm going out of town tomorrow and i hope I can get an answer to this. i have been checking my cm and it's increased, but it's still not clear and well slimy(sorry) it's just white and sticky ( sorry again) so what's that mean? i did take that gufiensin??.... stuff in robitusin -like ya'll said, sorry for the southern slang. should i continue to take that. my 14th day is sat. thanks for all your help ladies, have a grat weekend.

Hope,My guess would be ovulation is near. I know I know, big help I am, huh? Sorry. Are you going out of town with hubby? If so, b'dance like crazy...lol. Capermom is very knowledgeable about this and I hope she can post soon with more detialed information. Have a great weekend and be safe.Chloe,I didn't get back from the orthopedic surgeon until late so I guess I missed you online. Wishing you well tomorrow and know I'll be online waiting for you to get back. Good luck hun!Heather

Hey, sorry I was out. Yes, keep taking it util you're quite sure that you o'd and then stop in case you conceive. Drink tons of water, in increases cm. You could have O'd already, it goes to a think sticky white right after O, hard to know. Keep up the babydancing!!! Go girl. Good luck, sending baby wishes your way.
Hey,I had to take the 1 hour glucose test but not the three hour on your one hour did you get sick or anything I never heard of a 3 hour glucose test...good luck.Melissa

Hey,I just read your post on your page from yesterday the one you left today on it and I know my problem is really because he want sleep I didn't think I could get depressed with him because he has been through so much but I think maybe your so sad and everything because your baby is growing up right before your eyes and you miss holding and snuggling with him and him depending on you for every lil thing now he is one and he is a lil more independed now and doesn't need mommy as much as he did before and you also might want another lil one to keep you busy well good luck with everything at the doctor.~melissa~
